intro: Schultesia neuroptera, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow-orange ray florets that surround a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Schultesia neuroptera thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
